Business_AssetObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Business_AssetObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Business_AssetObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Request_References.description: References to existing Assets to return data for in the response.

description: The Request References element contains the specific instance set that should be returned in the Get operation. Either a Reference ID or the Workday ID (GUID) should be specified for each instance to be returned.

CompanyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Request_Criteria.description: One or more Company references to use to filter the assets returned in the response.

Accounting_WorktagObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.
For types that require a parent reference, contains a unique identifier for an instance of a parent object.
For types that require a parent reference, the unique identifier type of a parent object.

Accounting_WorktagObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Request_Criteria.description: One or more Worktag references to be used to find Assets currently assigned any of these worktags. To filter based on Location, use the Location Reference element.

Document_StatusObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Document_StatusObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Document_StatusObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Request_Criteria.description: One or more Asset Status reference to use to find assets currently in those statuses.

Acquisition_MethodObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Acquisition_MethodObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Acquisition_MethodObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Request_Criteria.description: One or more Acquisition Method references to use to find assets acquired using one of those methods.

Business_Asset_Disposal_MethodObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Business_Asset_Disposal_MethodObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Business_Asset_Disposal_MethodObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Request_Criteria.description: One or more Asset Disposal Method references to find assets disposed of using those methods.
Allows you to find assets by the date they were acquired. This is the From Date to find assets by acquisition date. This date is inclusive.

validation.validation: If Acquisition From Date or To Date is provided, the other must be provided also.

Asset_Request_Criteria.description: Allows you to find assets by the date they were acquired. This is the To Date to find assets by acquisition date. This date is inclusive.

Allows you to find assets by when they were updated. This is the From Date to use to find all types of asset activity within a date range (Acquisition, Cost Adjustment, Disposal, Reinstatement, Issue, Transfer). Assets with activity in this date range will be returned in the response.

validation.validation: If either Updated From Date or To Date is provided, the other must be provided also.

Asset_Request_Criteria.description: Allows you to find assets by when they were updated. This is the To Date to use to find all types of asset activity within a date range (Acquisition, Cost Adjustment, Disposal, Reinstatement, Issue, Transfer). Assets with activity in this date range will be returned in the response.

description: The Request Criteria is a wrapper element around a list of elements representing the operation specific criteria needed to search for assets.

validation.validation: At least one field must be populated in order to search.

Response_Filter.description: Indicates the date when application data, such as benefits and compensation, become effective (Also referred to as the Effective Moment). If you don't specify a date, this date defaults to today.{+4}
The date and time the data was entered into the system. (This field is also referred to as the Entry Moment). If the date isn't specified, the default date is the current date and time.

The numbered page of data Workday returns in the response. The default page is the first page(Page = 1). For responses that contain more than one page of data, use this parameter to retrieve the additional pages of data. For example, set Page = 2 to retrieve the second page of data.Note: If you set the page parameter, you must also specify the "As_Of_Entry_Date" to ensure that the result set remains the same between your requests.
Sets the number of objects to return within each response page. Set a value between 1 and 999. The default value is 100.

description: Parameters that let you filter the data returned in the response. You can filter returned data by dates and page attributes.

Asset_Response_Group.description: If true, a reference to the primary business object will be returned in the Get Response.
If true, includes the Custodian Data element in the response.
If true, includes the Depreciation Data element in the response.
If true, includes the Depreciation Detail Data element in the response.
If true, includes the Disposal Data element in the response.
If true, includes the Intercompany Transfer Data element in the response.
If true, includes the Impairment Data element in the response.
If true, includes the Reinstatement Data element in the response.
If true, includes the In Service Schedule Data element in the response.
If true, includes the Cost Adjustment Data element in the response.
If true, includes the Attachment Data element in the response.
If true, includes the Reclassification Data element in the response.
If true, includes the Removal Data element in the response.

description: The Response Group is a wrapper element around a list of elements representing the amount of data that should be included in the response.
